articles.author: David Lawder, Jorgelina Rosario
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund said on Friday it has reached a staff-level agreement with Argentina to unlock about $7.5 billion and complete the fifth and sixth reviews of the struggling country's $44 billion loan program.
articles.title: IMF, Argentina reach staff deal on loan reviews to unlock $7.5 bln

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The White House on Friday revised its fiscal 2023 U.S. budget deficit forecast to $1.543 trillion, a decrease of $26 billion from its March budget forecast, due largely to a major reduction in outlays after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Joe Biden's student loan forgiveness program.
articles.title: White House cuts 2023 US deficit forecast after student loan forgiveness struck down

articles.author: Michael Derby
articles.description: Less tight financial conditions as exhibited by the red-hot stock market may increase the chances that the Federal Reserve hikes rates again before the end of the year, some economists reckon, even as financial markets put little odds on that happening.
articles.title: Endgame for Fed's tightening cycle challenged by easing financial conditions

articles.author: David Randall
articles.description: A resilient U.S. economy and expectations of a nearing peak in the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy tightening cycle are emboldening stock investors, even as worries persist over rising valuations and the potential for inflation to rebound.
articles.title: Wall St Week Ahead Hopes of 'Goldilocks' economy, rate peak buoy US stocks

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: Annual U.S. inflation rose at its slowest pace in more than two years in June, with underlying price pressures receding, a trend that, if sustained, could push the Federal Reserve closer to ending its fastest interest rate hiking cycle since the 1980s.
articles.title: US annual inflation posts smallest rise in more than two years

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Friday shot down Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ.N) second attempt to resolve tens of thousands of lawsuits over its talc products in bankruptcy, imperiling a proposed $8.9 billion settlement that would stop new lawsuits from being filed.
articles.title: J&J effort to resolve talc lawsuits in bankruptcy fails a second time

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk said on Friday monthly users of social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter, reached a "new high" and shared a graph that showed the latest count as over 540 million.
articles.title: Musk says X monthly users reach 'new high'

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Wagner mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin, who remains active despite leading a failed mutiny against the Russian army's top brass last month, has hailed Niger's military coup as good news and offered his fighters' services to bring order.
articles.title: 'Exiled' Russian mercenary boss Prigozhin hails Niger coup, touts services

articles.author: Steve Holland, Heather Timmons
articles.description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell's unexplained freezeup while speaking in Congress this week is the latest reminder that America's most powerful political leaders are much older than many in other democracies.
articles.title: McConnell, Biden lapses highlight advanced age of US leaders

articles.author: Mike Stone, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States unveiled a Taiwan weapons aid package worth up to $345 million on Friday, a move likely to anger China even as the Biden administration declined to publicly provide details on the arms in the package.
articles.title: US announces Taiwan weapons package worth up to $345 mln
